intro: Hieracium floribundum subsp. pseudauricula, commonly known as the false golden hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal and cauline leaves that are hairy and often lobed. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in moist meadows and grasslands, often forming dense colonies.
